snippet: After labor’s political clout fell short in the 2010 elections, unions are hoping two new strategies will beef up their efforts.
abstract: Unions, seeking to strengthen their waning political influence after 2010 election, and to support the re-election of Pres Obama, are welcoming members of outside groups to join their canvasses and phone banks, as well as calling and visiting nonunion households.
lead_paragraph: After labor’s political clout fell short in the 2010 elections, unions are hoping two new strategies will beef up their efforts.

headline.seo: Unions Recruit Allies on Obama’s Behalf
headline.main: Unions Recruit New Allies for Obama in Battleground States
headline.print_headline: Unions Recruit New Allies To Fight for the President

keywords.value: Citizens United v Federal Election Commission (Supreme Court Decision)
keywords.name: subject
